Current Work

I'm currently focused on two main areas: building custom software solutions as a freelance developer and operating a seasonal business that brings holiday magic to homes across the region.

My work spans from technical problem-solving to hands-on business operations, giving me a unique perspective on both the development and business sides of technology.

Freelance Software Developer

Worked For:

Ace Workflow Gap Consulting
  • Lead Consultancies to scope and sell work
  • Lead and manage full builds, from initial call through warranty
  • Build custom internal apps and connect numerous data sources
  • Find unique ways to connect various SaaS used by companies via API or no-code / low-code tools

Tishman Speyer Bessemer Venture Partners We are Curated

Tis the Season Holiday Lighting

tistheseasonkc.com
  • Grown from 0 to ~1,000 customers in 7 years
  • Business partner and I install/remove all lights in field with 2 teams of 3-4
  • Angel runs all comms / office functions with our internal tools
  • Churn rate is around 5%, sell 100-150 new customers each year
  • Install all customers (existing + new) in ~50-58 days (fun optimization problem)

Why Sourcegraph?

Thorsten Ball's writing about programming, and lately AI in partciular, stands out as a source of truth in a vast ocen of noise. I've spent waaayy too much time in my .zshrc file because of his How Fast Is Your Shell? post. I noticed when Thorsten left Sourcegraph to work at Zed, and has now returned to Sourcegraph. To me that says Sourcegraph's leadership respects their employees, and truly wants to see them succeed personally and professionally. Thorsten's experience there sounds amazing. I want to contribute to a company like that with people like that.

I'm good at sales at sales. When I started Great Plains Painting I didn't know how to sell and I had to learn quick. In 5 months I sold about $350k of projects. The next year I sold ~$750k. The year after I began hiring sales reps and we were selling about $950k-$1mil.

I'm addicted to building software that makes people go, "that's so cool!". For my other company, Tis the Season when we had about 400-500 customers, our comms person (Angela) was making everyone's invoice, manually, 1 by 1. It took her a full day, and she did not love it. I hooked our customer data from Airtable up to Quickbooks, and with one button press in less than 5 seconds, she could create all the invoices and send a link in a text to all our customers. She said, "that's so cool!".

I think I can combine my knowledge of and passion for software with my sales experience to excel in the Account Executive role at Sourcegraph.

Things About Me

  • I'm 39 years old.
  • I live in Santa Barbara, CA but plan to move to Denver Area in September this year. I am not opposed to moving elsewhere should it be needed, and I have the flexiblity to do so.
  • If you hire me, I'd sell my interest in my company Tis the Season (I still actively operate it).
  • I've been remote working since 2015.
  • I love cats.
